title: Sasak (2007) New Testament (Print) SABDA
description: The Sasak language is spoken by the Sasak ethnic group, which makes up the majority of the population of Lombok in Indonesia. It is closely related to the Balinese and Sumbawa languages spoken on adjacent islands and is part of the Austronesian language family. Sasak has no official status; the national language, Indonesian, is the official and literary language in areas where Sasak is spoken.

language.name: Sasak
language.location: Indonesia, Nusa Tenggara and Southwestern Maluku
